comment.author: 87288428@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eveenhaddad] How it ended up with this waterfall, and the national park, is not a good story. You see the end of the lake? There's since long time ago a huge dam, serving as a water magazine for hydroplants downstream with a total effect of 4,3 GW, a large number. And now 95% of the water flow is passing through a underground plant. Left is a stream of 6 m3/s, usually it was 160 m3/s. It's a shame, the lake system upstream was broken out of the national park.
